name: deimosrising
text: Look at RB's face as he says "racism" and tell me this strip is less than a 4. I challenge you to this, but you cannot.

name: wehavemagnums
text: Daaamn, you're right

name: catachresis
text: His face is totally conveying that he is speaking in italics

name: waddlerz
text:
all trying real hard
all forming the words

name: epicurus
text: It's true, somehow you know the voice that goes with that face.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Also his shirt collar on about p3-4 looks like a little dang goatee. Which kinda looks hella sporting on Mr. Kazantzakis.

name: letterswewrote
text: ya i think that something that is rarely mentioned outside of the comments on this sight, but ought to be, is that onstad is a really effective illustrator.

name: senseihollywood
text: it's the Alec Trebec face

name: 1000hz
text: I must remember to enter a scene using "m'blokes"

name: cdl146
text: Almost as good as m'buches.

name: patkun
text: Why does Philippe feel he has to wear a hat while being the President?

name: slalvation
text: Otherwise you couldn't tell the difference between the President and a regular guy.

name: zapatos
text: If he didn't my mom would think a talking penis was president.  That's not so bad, but we don't want her getting the wrong idea.

name: professoryes
text: I will give this much to Ray and Philippe: They have ideas that work. (In a parallel universe where bad ideas work, but nonetheless still work...)

name: dasilodavi
text: See, now I don't know who's taking this campaign seriously.

name: twohundredninety
text: I love Philippe's choice of the word "win" in panel 6.

name: mindbnder
text: Philippe is trying to bring classy headware back into the political arena.

name: rowboat
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: boredom_man
text: Now that's the face that belongs on the dime!

name: invidious
text: Which, coincidentally, is how much the dollar was worth by the time he left office.

name: samuraieaux
text: A comment left by samuraieaux was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, TonyHighwind, GMM, Spenham, biacat, xiaomimi, newwavepony, choosebro, NumberKillinger, stormagnet)

name: bixschmix
text: You're right, it's impossible that two witty people could have made this connection independently.

name: theplaidknight
text: Which witty person besides Onstad made that connection?

name: bixschmix
text: Touche.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Molly: Stand by your man...

name: achilleselbow
text: I don't know if anyone realized this, but Philippe pretty much has the correct opinion on both those issues (assuming that his liking of Italians doesn't mean that he hates other races/nationalities).

name: dorothypoopbot
text: I think it's just that he's nice. Being a sweet-tempered five-year-old and all.

name: sp1derbaby
text:
Not all people are nice. Some people are Italian. If you accept these statements then you have to allow for the possibility that some Italian people are not nice.

Also, Mussolini.

name: gmm
text: Yeah, Mussolini pretty much wrecks Phillipe's theory here.

name: mangtastic
text: And let us not forget ruthless mafia dons.

name: dumase
text: nor Wario.

name: mangtastic
text: Yeah, FUCK Wario.  What kind of asshole wears purple suspenders with a yellow shirt?  That shit is fuckin' gaudy as hell.

name: acefalco
text:
They're overalls, but you get a chubby for the sheer vehemence of your statement.

Screw you, Wario. FUCK you.

name: falseprophet
text:
I think Ray is a member of the same think tank that came up with the Gas Tax Holiday.

Oh snap I just got political.

name: scion
text: I am considering voting for Phillipe then becoming homeless.

name: deus
text: Thats it Philippe, one step at the time.

name: rumblefish
text: For anyone worried that Philippe's paper hat isn't suitably presidential, it's made out of the U.S. Constitution.

name: razorman57
text: These Phillippe for president strips i love, because in every one Phillippe is wearing a different hat, and they are amazing. but still incomparable to the great moment in cinema with roomba. that is teh win.

name: johnnybaverage
text: I am probably going to get lamed all to hell for saying this, but the "Philippe runs for President" arc is easily my least favorite. That said, I appreciate that Onstad broke it up into smaller chunks and spread it throughout storylines. If it were one continuous arc I would absolutely despise it. As it is, it's just "enh."
